DataElement.preferredName: Genetic Marker Relative Value Location Type MarkerRelativeLocationType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.:Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._The source project of genetic linkage maps, the MarkerRelativeLocation (in unit of centiMorgan (cM) distance to p-telomere) is derived from. Or the type of markers the relative base pair distance of SNP on the chromosome is derived from.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.:Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.:Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A segment of DNA with an identifiable physical location on a chromosome and whose inheritance can be followed.
Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/8/12 Released as part of caBIO v4.3 model cleanup task.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The source project of genetic linkage maps, the MarkerRelativeLocation (in unit of centiMorgan (cM) distance to p-telomere) is derived from. Or the type of markers the relative base pair distance of SNP on the chromosome is derived from.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.:A high resolution genetic map based on 5136 microsatellite markers in 146 Icelandic families.

Concepts.definition: A high resolution genetic map based on 5136 microsatellite markers in 146 Icelandic families.
Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Marshfield Linkage Map Polymorphic Microsatellite Marker

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Marshfield Linkage Map Polymorphic Microsatellite Marker
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.:A microsatellite-based human genetic map based on 7740 microsatellite markers originally identified at the Marshfield Clinic.

Concepts.definition: A microsatellite-based human genetic map based on 7740 microsatellite markers originally identified at the Marshfield Clinic.
Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.

Concepts.definition: Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: SLM1 Linkage Map Polymorphic Microsatellite Marker

ValueMeaning.preferredName: SLM1 Linkage Map Polymorphic Microsatellite Marker
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.:A human linkage map generated from unpublished data from Affymetrix and Dr. Aravinda Chakravarti's group at Johns Hopkins University, based on genotypes for 2022 microsatellite markers and 6205 SNPs.

Concepts.definition: A human linkage map generated from unpublished data from Affymetrix and Dr. Aravinda Chakravarti's group at Johns Hopkins University, based on genotypes for 2022 microsatellite markers and 6205 SNPs.
Short repeats of nucleotide sequences present throughout the genome which exhibit variations within a population.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
